releases.title: Example PPP
releases.description: The Example PPP project will guarantee the installation of a wholesale shared network that allows the provision of telecommunications services by current and future operators. The project will increase the telecommunication services coverage, promote competitive prices and enhance the quality of services according to international standards.

budget.description: Predicted public and private sector investment over the duration of the project

planning.rationale: The project will increase the telecommunication services coverage, promote competitive prices and enhance the quality of services according to international standards.

project.title: Example PPP
project.description: The Example PPP project will guarantee the installation of a wholesale shared network that allows the provision of telecommunications services by current and future operators.

documents.description: The project will increase the telecommunication services coverage, promote competitive prices and enhance the quality of services according to international standards.
documents.author: Example Consultancy Services Ltd

milestones.title: Public consultation
milestones.description: A public consultation will be held at the offices of the Ministry of Communications on 1st December 2015.

milestones.title: Strategic outline case approval
milestones.description: Ministry of Finance approved the strategic outline business case for the project

releases.title: Example PPP
releases.description: The Example PPP project will guarantee the installation of a wholesale shared network that allows the provision of telecommunications services by current and future operators. The project will increase the telecommunication services coverage, promote competitive prices and enhance the quality of services according to international standards.

tender.title: Example PPP pre-qualification
tender.description: Bidders are invited to submit requests to participate in the Example PPP.
tender.procurementMethodDetails: The project will be awarded through a two-stage process
tender.awardCriteriaDetails: Percentage of people aggregated nationwide contestants undertake to cover, as indicated in their Economic Bids. The evaluation of proposals will be conducted based on the provisions of Article Y of the law on public private partnerships, and the provisions of the tender rules, performing in a first stage an evaluation of the technical bids and subsequently an assessment of the financial offer of the participants.
tender.submissionMethodDetails: Each contestant may submit only one request. The address for delivery of the request is: Ministry of Communications, 1 Main Street, Capital City, Capital State, CS 123456
tender.eligibilityCriteria: Contestants must prove their administrative, economic, financial and technical capacity with various documents established in tender rules.

documents.description: Request for qualification documents for example PPP
documents.author: Ministry of Communications

beneficialOwnership.description: Alpha Holdings is wholly controlled by Alpha Trust

evaluationIndicators.riskPremiumDetails: Based on a market risk premium of 6.0% (per government guidelines) and an asset beta of 0.45 (per a sample of listed telecommunication network providers) the project risk allocation gives rise to a risk premium of 0.92%
evaluationIndicators.discountRateDetails: Based on the current long term public sector bond rate

milestones.title: Financial close
milestones.description: All the project and financing agreements must be signed and all the required conditions contained in them must be met.

requirementResponses.title: Bid Coverage
requirementResponses.description: Mega Consortium proposes a total coverage level of 92.2%

riskAllocation.description: Risks arising from the Project
Risks arising from the maintenance, use and operation of the pair of optic fiber strands (filaments) of the Backbone Network
Environmental risks
Risks deriving from the compliance or lack thereof of regulatory obligations related to the development of the Project
Risks deriving from procurement or lack thereof of the necessary licenses and permits for the Project’s development
Risks arising from the procurement or lack thereof of rights of way required for the Project’s development
Financial risks including interest rate risk, exchange rate risk and bankability risk
Risks related to the financing of the Project
Risks due to variations or increase in the cost of the Project’s execution
Risks due to fortuitous or force majeure events
Risks deriving from the breach of any obligations assumed by subcontractors
Others set forth in, or arising from the execution of, this Agreement
riskAllocation.notes: The private party assumes all risks relating to the project.
